title: RC circuits - 3 resistors and 1 capacitor current

content.description: The circuit shown consists of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>emf</mtext></mstyle></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>, a switch, a capacitor of capacitance <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"> <mi>C</mi> </math>, and three identical resistors each of resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The switch is initially open, and the capacitor is uncharged. The switch is then closed.
content.question: What is the current in the battery when the circuit has reached a steady state after the switch is closed?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction script uppercase E over 3 R" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction script uppercase E over 2 R" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 3 script uppercase E over R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>Ɛ</mi></mrow><mi>R</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction script uppercase E over 3 R" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
